problem_text:
(A. Mader). “Standard B”, that is, B = Z(p) ⊕Z(p2) ⊕· · · , is slender as a module over its endomorphism ring (A. Mader, in: Abelian Groups and Modules, Proc., Udine, 1984, Springer, 1984, 315–327). Which abelian p-groups are slender as modules over their endomorphism rings?
S. V. Rychkov
